IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Simpson College is an independent, selective, church-related, comprehensive liberal arts college dedicated to excellence in higher education. The Simpson College community is equally committed to: Promoting integrative learning that enables students of all ages to develop intellectual and practical skills; Nurturing values which foster personal worth and individuality within a creative, diverse and just community; Graduating students who continue to grow as free, responsible and fulfilled individuals in the world of family, work, service and scholarship; Drawing upon our relationship with the United Methodist Church and our religious traditions that guide us on issues of personal integrity, moral responsibility, social justice and global citizenship.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Simpson College is an independent, selective, church-related, comprehensive liberal arts college dedicated to excellence in higher education. The Simpson College community is equally committed to: Promoting integrative learning that enables students of all ages to develop intellectual and practical skills; Nurturing values which foster personal worth and individuality within a creative, diverse and just community; Graduating students who continue to grow as free, responsible and fulfilled individuals in the world of family, work, service and scholarship; Drawing upon our relationship with the United Methodist Church and our religious traditions that guide us on issues of personal integrity, moral responsibility, social justice and global citizenship.
IRS990.Description: Scholarship Programs: Scholarships and grants to students. (1,428 students)

Activity2.Description: Higher Education Instruction: Instruction and academic support was provided to full and part-time students. (2,021 students)

Activity3.Description: Student Services Programs: Student services, including student development, academic and career counseling, college chaplain, intercollegiate athletics, financial assistance and other services, was provided to full and part-time students. (2,021 students)

ActivityOther.Description: Student Services Auxiliary Enterprises: Auxiliary enterprises including housing, food services and conferencing facilities available for student use. (2,021 students)

Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: Vice President and Dean for Academic Affairs

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Simpson College is a member of the Iowa Association of Independent Colleges and Universities (IAICU). As calculated by IAICU, twelve percent of the dues paid by the college are attributed to lobbying expenditures incurred by the organization.

OtherSecurities.Description: Interest in private equity limited partnerships
Interest in real estate investment trusts
Cash surrender value of life insurance policies

InvestmentsProgramRelated.Description: Federal Perkins Loan due from students

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Simpson College endowment is intended to support the College's students by providing scholarship and loan funds and the endowment is intended to support the College by providing support for operations and facilities.

The disclosures for FIN 48 were not required to be made for the year ended May 31, 2010. However, the auditors did perform tests related to FIN 48 and did not identify any liability for uncertain tax positions.
Student aid netted against tuition and fees in the audited financial statements.
Student aid netted against tuition and fees in the audited financial statements.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: College publications to students, alumni and friends of the College include a statement of the College's racially nondiscriminatory policy.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The College receives student financial aid under Title IV and other assistance from the Federal government and from the State of Iowa. A significant portion of this assistance is "pass through" to qualifying students.

AcctsActvsOutUSTable.SpecificServicesProvided: Student semester abroad and May Term course travel
Student semester abroad and May Term course travel
Student semester abroad and May Term course travel

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: Scholarships and grants to Simpson College students

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Grants or assistance provided is all for scholarships and grants to Simpson College students which are applied directly to the student's tuition charges. The Office of Financial Assistance awards scholarships and grants to students based on a variety of different criteria for each scholarship.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The president's spouse periodically travels with the President to official College functions. The spouse's travel is paid by the College when the official College function dictates such participation such as for donor relations and alumni events. The President is provided a residence in which he/she is required to live. The residence is regularly used for College functions. An estimated fair value of $25,804 has been included under Part VII, Section A, column (F) of the Form 990. Finally, the President is provided with membership to a local country club. The annual membership cost is included in reportable compensation in the amount of $1,740.

The Executive Compensation Committee of the Board of Trustees consists of the Treasurer, Secretary and Chairperson of the Board, which are all independent members of the Board of Trustees. The Committee is charged with reviewing and approving the compensation and benefits for the President. The Committee uses comparability data such as a survey issued to several private colleges regarding total compensation for a president conducted by an independent compensation consultant and salary data for private college administrator positions provided by a state association of independent private colleges. The Committee approves all salary and long-term incentive awards for the President's written employment contract. Minutes of all Committee meetings are kept and maintained. The Committee is required to inform the full Board of Trustees of all provisions and elements of the President's compensation.

Form990ScheduleKPartI.DescriptionOfPurpose: Various campus buildings and residence hall improvements.
Refunding of taxable loan (9/10/2008); acquisition of machinery, equipment, property, and fixtures.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Trustee is a director of a bank which has provided a loan to the College
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Interest and fees on loan with the bank

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Trustee is a key employee of a lumber and construction materials supplier
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Purchase of construction materials under open and competitive bidding

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Spouse of officer of the College
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Annual compensation as a full time employee in the Office of College Advancement

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Spouse of a Board of Trustee member
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Compensation as an adjunct instructor of the College

OtherNonCashContributionsTable.Description: Use of vehicle provided to President

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Robert J Lane, Vice President for College Advancement, and Deb J Tierney, Vice President for Enrollment, are in-laws.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The return preparer reviews a draft copy of the Form 990 with the President and Vice President for Business & Finance. The return preparer and the Vice President for Business & Finance reviewed the draft and addressed questions with a tax expert who is part of the accounting firm that audits the College. Appropriate changes were made to the Form 990 based on these reviews. Then, the final draft of the return is made available to all trustee members prior to filing. The return is made available electronically through the College portal in which all trustee members have access. An email is also sent to the trustee members stating the return is available on the College portal and any comments or questions may be directed to management or the Audit and Compliance Committee of the Board of Trustees. Finally, prior to the return filing, a meeting of the Audit and Compliance Committee of the Board of Trustees is held in which managment review the Form 990 with the Committee. The tax expert also participated in the meeting with the Audit and Compliance Committee. Appropriate changes were made to the Form 990 at the direction of the Audit and Compliance Committtee before filing.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: As required by the College bylaws, all trustees, officers and key employees are required to disclose annually interests that could give rise to conflicts. All reported information is compiled under the direction of the President. A summary is provided to the Audit and Compliance Committee of the Board of Trustees who then determines whether further review or action is necessary.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive Compensation Committee of the Board of Trustees consists of the Treasurer, Secretary, and Chairperson of the Board, which are all independent members of the Board of Trustees. The Committee is charged with reviewing and approving the compensation of cabinet-level administrators. The Committee uses comparability data such as a survey issued to several private colleges regarding total compensation for a president conducted by an independent compensation consultant and salary data for private college administrator positions provided by a state association of independent private colleges. Minutes of all Committee meetings are kept and maintained. The Committee is required to inform the full Board of Trustees of all provisions and elements of the President's compensation. The Committee last reviewed the compensation package of the President and cabinet-level adminstrators during the year ended in May 2009.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Upon written request to the President or Vice President for Business & Finance, the College will make its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public.
